AI4 Will Be Capable Of Self-Driving On Monday, user @iliketeslas shared a post on the social media platform X, stating that the current AI4 chips are capable of running Unsupervised FSD without "better hardware." Anyone using AI4 right now knows that better hardware is not needed for unsupervised dr

item.title: [VRT] 2026’s Biggest AI Trends: The Rise of AI Factories | VRT Stock, NVT Stock, MOD Stock
item.description: 24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics. In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

item.description: In 2021, a 34-year-old investor followed what sounded like standard advice. He rolled about $50,000 from his 401(k) into a Traditional IRA with the help of a local financial advisor. Then he did what many people are told to do with retirement money. “I've for the most part ignored it as that was always the advice I was given,” he wrote in Reddit’s personal finance community recently. Amazon shares were the worst performers among the Mag Seven in 2025, their seventh straight year trailing the group.

item.title: [GOOG] Netflix defends Warner Bros bid as shares drop on tepid results
item.description: Jan 21 (Reuters) - "YouTube is not just user-generated content and cat videos anymore," Netflix CEO Ted Sarandos said on Tuesday. Making a compelling case for why the streaming giant wanted Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming assets, Sarandos noted how tech giants such ​as Alphabet's YouTube had changed what television viewing meant and forced Netflix to change tack to keep up. Sarandos and his co-CEO Greg Peters spent a large portion of the post-earnings call talking effusively about how strong and complementary Warner Bros' services were, a sharp change from the long-held company credo: build, don't buy.

item.title: [GOOG] Microsoft clicks on Formula One grid with new Mercedes deal
item.description: Microsoft, the $3.4trn computing behemoth, will this week unveil a partnership with the Mercedes Formula One team that will underline the sport's resurgent appeal among the world's biggest technology companies. Sky News understands that Microsoft will be announced as a major sponsor of the Brackley-based outfit when it unveils its 2026 car livery and design at an event on Thursday. The deal will make Microsoft the latest tech company to sign a big commercial agreement in F1, with rivals such as Google already having a presence through a partnership with McLaren Racing, the reigning world champions.

item.title: [BRH.F] Berkshire Hathaway May Sell Stock in Kraft Heinz, Filing States
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway may sell shares from its $7.8 billion equity stake in Kraft Heinz according to a prospectus filed late Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The front page of the prospectus says that Berkshire, which received the Kraft Heinz equity as part of a merger of Kraft and Heinz in 2015, may “offer to sell from time to time” shares from that stake. Berkshire now holds a 27.5% stake in the food company—or 325.4 million shares.
